column4: the ant will gently tap the body of the aphid
column5: and thus obtain a supply of the sweet fluid. After feasting on this
column6: the ant will pass to another little aphis and treat it in the same manner for another drop. But the ant has sense enough to treat the aphis as we treat our cows. Our farmers
column8: keep the cows in enclosed meadows
column9: and supply them with hay and turnips when the grass fails. The ants also take a number of aphides close to their nests
column10: and there keep them secure and supply them with suitable food. Now the ladybirds are also fond of the aphides
column11: and eat them up by hundreds.
